definition: something joined or added to another thing but not essentially a part of it
examples: The website is designed as an adjunct to the book.

definition: a word or word group that qualifies or completes the meaning of another word or other words and is not itself a main structural element in its sentence

an adverb or adverbial phrase (such as heartily in "They ate heartily" or at noon in "We left at noon") attached to the verb of a clause especially to express a relation of time, place, frequency, degree, or manner â€” compare disjunct sense 2
an associate or assistant of another
an adjunct faculty member at a college or university (see adjunct entry 2 sense 2)
added or joined as an accompanying object or circumstance
attached in a subordinate or temporary capacity to a staff
